column1: ooo what a start! Back of a length outside off, swings back in, he doesn't know what to do and pokes. Beaten.
good length, pitches on leg stump. Roy walks across the stumps and gets beaten down the leg side. No wide.
good length on middle stump, pokes at it and gets a thick inside edge past short fine
full, swinging in from middle, this time gets a confident stride forward and drives to the right of mid-on
back of a length, angled across the corridor, stands on his toes and punches it square. Third man runs to his right to cut it
back of a length, angled across off stump, slashes at it and is beaten
drops it short outside off, he gets behind and punches regally past a diving extra cover
fired in full at the pads, driven to long-on
good length outside off, slides through quick and low, McCullum has gone back to this when he shouldn't have. Tries to punch it put it gets the bottom edge low on the bat and the stumps light up
good length at off stump, gets low on one knee and slaps it behind square for a six first ball!
good length outside off, draws him forward and beats his outside edge with a slider
full outside off, gets on knee and goes for the sweep again, gets an inside edge and sneaks by from under the keeper
back of a length outside off, leans back and punches to point's right
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
good length, angling into the pads from middle and off, leans forward and punches it through the open midwicket region. Deep square runs a long way
good length, slower ball outside off, waits for it and drops it into the gully area with soft hands

back of a length and angled across, but he steps out and cuts down the angle as he slogs across. Hasn't connected properly and deep square leg runs a long way and puts a big dive to his left to flick it back in. Young Usman Khan. They're checking to see if he touched the rope...and he hasn't
full at off stump, no feet as he looks to pummel this down the ground. Big gap between bat and pad, but safely driven to long-on
wide of the crease, back of a length, angling in from the corridor, punched off the back foot to mid-on with the angle
wow! Some shot this. It's full and angling away from outside off but he's dragged this and connected the slog beautifully. That's straight out of street cricket.
full and outside off again, goes for the slog again, but this time it's an outside edge and flied to the third man boundary

he moves around in the crease and tees up like a baseball batter, Hasan bowls him a slower one. He tries to tickle it fine but doesn't run whereas Roy has already reached the striker's end. Poor throw from Sangakkara and no damage
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, goes back and heaves it, but poor connection and it trickles to deep square
good length outside off, goes through the line and slaps it to extra cover's left. He puts in a dive and parries it to mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabs it down to third man
good length and at middle stump, punched to mid-on to sneak in a quick single
good length at off stump, but it really doesn't matter anymore. Steps out and slams this high into the sky, and it falls just short of the long-off boundary
back of a length at off stump, steered down to third man
back of a length on middle stump, sits up nicely and he slogs this on the up, flat over the deep midwicket boundary
good length at leg stump, makes room but gets followed as he punches this to long-on with the full face
back of a length outside off, makes room to try and slap it through the off side, but doesn't middle it. Straight to covers
he's thrown it away and he knows it! Dreadful shot. Walks across his stumps to try and paddle it fine. It was a slower ball and full at off stump, he missed it completely and is livid with himself
good length, angled in at off stump, he leans forward and pushes with hard hands. Bat turns and he gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
full outside off, goes across the line again but this time in the V. Punched past the non-striker
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
slower ball, good length outside off, walks across, waits for it and check-punches it back past the bowler. Mid-on and mid-off converge
good length at off, goes right forward and defends
floated in on off stump, driven down to long-off
full outside off, tries to drive this but gets a thick outside edge to short third man
full outside off, brings out the reverse sweep and connects, but straight to the fielder
good length at off stump, back foot defence
tossed up at a good length outside off, tries to make room and hit it over cover, but gets it wrong and it bounces into sweeper cover's hands
140 kph, good length outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
back of a length on off stump, pushes off the back foot through midwicket
back of a length at middle, walks across and glances it to deep square
135 kph, back of a length at middle, backs away and cramps himself, pushed to point
tries to follow him down the leg side and pitches it a few inches to his right and it flies to the fine leg boundary
127 kph, full outside off, steps outside and tries to slog this full toss but is beaten completely
good length and slides down the leg side
back of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to long-on
tossed up outside off, steps down and creams it with an angled back straight over his partner at the non-strikers. One bounce and into the fence
tossed up at middle stump, pushed down to long-on
good length outside off, steps out and doesn't get to the pitch. But he goes through with the shot and in the end it's one bounce and past long-off
good length at middle stump, uses his wrists to turn it into the leg side and take off, but the keeper gets across quickly
good length at off stump, doesn't get to the pitch again as he drives. Hits the outside half of the bat and goes to sweeper cover

oh Sanga, what are you doing? Tossed up on middle stump, steps out and tries to hit this out of the stadium, hasn't got to the pitch, top-edge, Sanga calls for it, runs in circles, puts in a last ditch dive and drops it
good length outside off, slower ball, punched to sweeper cover
slower ball, full at off stump, hangs back and flicks to deep square
good length, angled in at off, makes room and swats it to deep midwicket

back of a length slower ball, hangs back and pulls it aerially, deep square leg gets across, uses the Aussie teachnique and makes a meal of it. Bursts through his hands. Dropped and bounces into the ropes
slower ball at middle stump, gets low and forward and uses his wrists to flick it behind square

good length, floated in at off stump, steps out and slaps it between long-on and deep-midwicket. There's a chaotic grace to his slogging - body tilted, back leg in the air as he uses full flexion to generate power
tossed up at leg stump, goes down the track and lifts it cleanly over long-on. The obligatory flash of talent from Umar Akmal.
full at off stump, driven past the bowler off the front foot
good length, tossed up at middle stump, sweeps it along the floor to deep midwicket

and obligatory throwing away of the wicket from Umar Akmal. You just expect this from him, don't you? Tossed up outside off, goes for an expansive inside-out shot over covers, isn't to the pitch and slices it nicely for Bopara at deep cover
pushed through flat, good length at middle stump, he goes back and cops it on the thigh guard
dropped short, goes back and slaps it to the right of sweeper cover
93 kph, short and wide, cut to backward point who fumbles it
back of a length outside off, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
Bopara is bowling off spine, for all practical purposes. Floated outside off at a good length, goes for the big sweep, gets a leading edge to long-off
good length at off stump, pushed with soft hands through midwicket and runs back quickly
in an interesting variation, Bopara bowls one seam up short at middle, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to deep cover for his half-century
good length outside off, steps out and drags it straight into the crowd at the long-on boundary...drilled that one
good length at middle, backs away to hit through the off side, spins back at him and it goes back to the bowler
makes room premeditatedly and digs himself into a hole. He pushes it wide, may have been a googly, Zaman steps out, doesn't get to the pitch, Shinwari runs backwards from point and holds on nicely
full outside off, gets slow and hits the ball 'on it's head'. Rolls his wrists nicely to sweep it past deep square
good length outside off, goes forward and pushes it to point
back of a length on the pads, goes back and glances through short gine
good length outside off, tries to drive through the offside, bat turns, long-on into business
back of a length, arm ball fired at off stump, pushed into the cover region with soft hands
full and aimed at leg stump, premeditated reverse sweep goes straight to point. Conventional sweep might have yielded more with that angle
full outside off, pushed to covers off the front foot
good length outside off, backs away and slaps it uppishly past cover who puts in a tumbling dive but can't reach it
good length at middle, steps out and pushes it down to long-on
back of a length at off from wide of the crease, uses the angle and nudges it into the leg side
back of a length, pitches on middle and goes down, catches him on the pad, bowler is the only one who appeals as it runs down to short fine
good length outside off, steps down the track and lifts it on the up over mid-off. Glorious.
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to long-on
slower ball, short and wide, chopped on the bounce to Imad at point
yorker aimed at middle stump, he goes low to try and scoop this, luckily gets the bottom of the bat and it rolls into the midwicket region
short and into the hips, turns it away easily behind square
back of a length on the hips, jumps up and glances it to deep square
yorker outside off, dug out to cover
full at off stump, clears his front foot and punches it down to long-off
142 kph, back of a length, angled across the batsman who opens the face and places it beautifully with a late dab
good length angled in at off stump, gets on his toes and pushes it in that awkward region between long-on and deep midwicket to pick up two
good length at off, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot. Beaten for pace there
good length, slower ball outside off, he's through with his slog early and is beaten
full and hits the pads hard on a leg stump line, great bowling here, Elliott's thinking hard, you can tell, which means he isn't playing freely
slower ball outside off, sits in a good length and bounces and climbs at him slowly, he goes across, is early again and can only just manage to get bat on it and turn it to square leg
good length outside off, walks across, goes for the big heave, misses it altogether and it flies past off stump
in the blockhole at middle stump, pushed out to deep midwicket
129 kph, fired into the blog hole, thick outside edge down to fine leg off the attempted flick
96 kph, slower length ball outside off, waits for the turn and slogs it one bounce to deep midwicket
back of the hand slower ball, full and wide outside off, reaches out for it and can only manage to throw a wild slog at it. Doesn't connect, rolls through to the keeper
into the blockhole at middle stump, jammed out towards deep midwicket. The superb length on that means he can't connect, and in the end it fetches him two runs
134 kph, attempted yorker, slightly misses his mark and it's a low full toss at middle, but he's caught in the crease as he tries to whip it across and it plumb in front
goes for his toes with a yorker, but misses his line slightly and that's a narrow wide

back of a length slower ball angled across him and he's pulled out the shot of an absolute legend. Is that Lara? Hangs back, swivels slightly and lifts it over long on with ease off the back foot. Stunning.
full outside off, walks across the stumps and turns it to long-on's right
good length outside off, frees his arms and slashes at it, this time he's nowhere close to it and we have Narine back
knee-high full toss at middle stump, thumped to long-on's right
full and angled down the leg, Sanga is annoyed as he collects this
hangs really deep in the crease as he drives this full ball at off stump straight to long-on
full at middle stump, stand-and-deliver style swat back over the umpire, but it's caught the bottom of the bat
low full toss outside off, he deposits it past sweeper cover's left
well-directed bouncer from around the wicket, cramps him around the rib cage as he walks across to try and find the gaps in leg side. Gets a glove on his hook and it's a dolly into Sanga's gloves
misses the yorker, low full toss on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
142 kph, back of a length and angled into him, goes for that pull again but it hits the sticker and carries easily to long-on
low full toss outside off, driven straight to cover
back of a length angled across him, goes for the pull but can't connect. Digs it into the pitch and it bounces down to long-off

good length outside off, tries to slg across the line, gets the bottom of the bat and goes to deep midwicket...and he's run out, hanging around lazily outside the crease after his partner refused the second run.
good length outside off, driven on the up to Baz at mid-off. Gayle was sent back. They've taken on his arm and he's hit it direct. Third umpire...will rule not out. He's grounded his bat nicely
good length on the pads, glanced to short fine
fires in a yorker at leg stump, uses his reach to convert it into a yorker to jam it to short fine
good length outside off, deviates away with the angle and called wide
back of a length outside off, leaves it alone
127 kph, good length at middle stump, very slight deviation away. Goes forward and pushes it to point who shies and breaks the stumps at the non-strikers end for no apparent reason
good length at middle, flicks it to mid-on
drops it short down the leg and he has literally hit a one-handed backhand to dispatch this behind square
good length at off stump, draws him forward and beats him on the outside edge

tossed up at middle stump, slightly back of a good length, no feet from Gayle, goes with his hands and his reach can't help him get under this before it turns. Top edge is the result and Akmal pouches it at long-off
good length, fired at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

drops it short and turns it away from off stump, Sanga hangs back and punches this with great placement through the covers. Roy chases and tries to pull it back in but it's caught the rope and third umpire will deem that a boundary
good length on off, drives on the up and slightly in the air, straight to cover
back of a length at off, punched towards mid-off, but extra cover puts in a dive to cut it halfway
good length, angled across from off stump, outside half of the bat as he tries to drive on the up, straight to cover
back of a length outside off, angled across, but he plays a peculiar shot. Gets in position for a back foot punch and lifts it over mid-on. You need great eyes to pull that off. Good shot.
back of a length angled across of, mistimes his pull shot and mid-on cuts it off
good length outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot
slower ball, good length at off stump, walks across and flicks it to short fine
back of a length, angled in at off stump, inside edge onto the pad and into the leg side
good length at middle stump, drives it on the up across the angle, straight to mid-on
back of a length, angled across the batsman who pokes at it off the back foot, straight to point
back of a length, angled across, chopped with no timing to point
good length on middle, angled across, jumps out and slaps it to mid-off who fumbles
short and wide, throws his hands at it, gets an outside edge and it carries straight to third man. He didn't have to move an inch. All hands from Babar, and hard ones at that.
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to mid-off's right off the back foot
back of length at middle, gets on his toes and places it gracefully in front of square
back of a length outside off, bunted off the back foot to short extra cover
back of a length outside off, drives on the up as it gets big on him and it catches the finger of Yasir Shah at point as he dives. Has to go down as a drop...but not without making us feel bad first
good length at off stump, thick inside edge on his attempted drive and it goes to mid-on who fires it in and might have caused some problems there if he had hit
back of a length on the hips, glanced to deep square
good length at middle, steps out and tries to cream this over the off side, but has no timing on it and just slices it over the infield
back of a length into his body, swivels and turns it down to fine leg...and it's a no-ball. Free hit
into the blockhole at off stump, and he can only dig it out to long-off
brings fine leg in and bowls short at chest height, so Sangakkara teaches him what not to do by pulling away four easy runs
back of a length outside off, goes for the pull, no timing, straight to mid-on on the bounce
full on the pads, clears the front foot and plays an ugly slog behind square for some pretty runs
good length on the pads, waits for it and pushes it past short fine's dive to the right
back of a length at off stump, hurries him and he just about chops it to point
steps out, meets it on the full on middle stump and drills it past Sanga, long-on runs in and puts in a dive to save the boundary
good length outside off, steps out, quickly realises he's not at the pitch and offers his pad. Catches him on it and bobs into the leg side
good length on off stump, turns in as he goes back and pushes it to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, turned into the leg side off the front foot
tossed up on middle, goes forward and uses his wrists to flick it to deep midwicket
back of a length at middle, turns away from him and he has to really watch it closely as he pulls it to deep midwicket
good length outside off, turns away from him as he goes back and pokes at it
attempted faster one, picks it and goes back to pull, deep square gets across
tossed up outside off, expands his stance to try and lift it over the off side, beaten outside the off. Appeal for stumping, not out.
good length outside off, walks across and goes for the slog sweep, beaten again as it climbs on him
good length at middle, goes back and pushes to deep midwicket
good length at off stump from around the wicket, turned into the leg side
rolls his fingers, good length outside off, punched to long-on
good length at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short and not wide enough for the cut, even though he goes for it and hits it one bounce to point
back of a length on leg stump, backs away and connects the pull straight to deep square
full at off stump, clears his foot and drills it back, Elliott gets low and gets some part of his body on it, or maybe boot, but it deviates into the midwicket region
short and wide, middles his cut to perfection but Elliott has done brilliantly at sweeper to runs across and slide to save the boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide, sits up for him and he blazes this through midwicket with a pull shot
full on the pads, midwicket is in and he lifts it ease to pick up some easy runs. Poor bowling
full outside off, expansive drive straight to mid-off
full on the pads, looks to tuck this behind short fine leg, gets a leading edge....and it lands safely in front of long-on

drops it short outside ff, Sanga bounces back and punches behind square. Sweeper gets across quickly, puts in a dive and puts in a great throw right next to the stumps...the bails are off and it's been reviewed...not out. Just in
dropped short at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, goes deep and slices it between short third man and point
good length at off stump, dabbed with soft hands towards point
drops it short, Sanga has gone too far across and has to reach out. Connects nicely nevertheless and sweeper is in action once again
good length at middle stump, makes room and goes over cover. Hasn't middled it and sweeper just about misses as he tries to run across and slap it back into play
full on off stump, gets under it and puts in a nice bat swing, but gets it low on the bat. It carries over long-on anyway
back of a length at off stump, backs away and pulls. This time he connects, but it's straight to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, makes room, is followed, but slaps it into the leg side to long-on's left
ooooooh! Slower ball floated at leg stump, he gets low and slog-sweeps this wayyyyyy over deep midwicket and it's out of the stadium
full outside off, outside edge, onto the keeper's pad and straight to point
full at middle stump, flicks it to long-on and brings up his half-century
good length, pushed flat at middle and hurries Sanga who just gets his bat down in time to flick it into the leg side
short of good length outside off, backs away and slaps it aerially to sweeper cover's left
huge! Tossed up outside off, gets on one knee and slams a slog sweep with all the grace that we've seen over the years, has that hit the roof? Looks like it.
fires in a faster one, drops it short, pulls it past midwicket but there's a deep fielder there to cut it off
he's not tossing it up anymore. Pushed flat and short into the pads, punched between long-on and deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to point
fires in a well-directed yorker but Sanga is in full control and he clips it off his toes behind square
good length, angled across off stump, pushed into the midwicket region off his front foot
low full toss at off stump, punched to long-on
short and wide, clobbered on the up but straight to sweeper cover
low full toss at middle, punched down to long-on
back of a length outside off, backs away to try and cut this away, but he's beaten on the inside edge
short outside off, he gets this so sweetly as he pulls it, but it's straight to deep midwicket. Cricket isn't always rewarding
full outside off, goes for the drive, jams it out to point
full outside off, tails away slightly and just past the wide marker
full outside off and past the wide marker again. He's getting some serious movement here, but the direction is way off
full outside off, slower ball this time, the keeper fumbles after Sanga is beaten
gets one at the stump and hits them! Good length, coming into Sanga this time and he walks at it and plays a dirty heave. Sneaks between bat and pad and smashes the stumps
almost gone first ball! Good length outside off, pushes to covers and takes off, direct hit and he'd be gone! Roy couldn't hit with a diving underarm throw
back of a length on off stump, flicked to deep square
short and wide down the leg side
back of a length outside off, pushed straight to point

Oh dear, this is awful from Malik. Good length outside off, his head is looking upwards, his feet haven't moved, his bat is looking to send it over midwicket, but his eyes eventually see it being pouched by Tanvir at third man
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, short arm jab down to long-on
goes for the bouncer, too short, loops over the big man's head
what a shot! Back of a length outside off, it's climbing, but he has the height. It's fast, but he has the power - punches it over mid-off and it goes one bounce
back of a length and catches him on the thigh guard. It trickles down in front of point
good length outside off, pokes it to short third and gets to the other end
sees the batsman make room and pushes it wide, but it spins past the indicator
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
short and wide, cut hard behind square, deep cover runs to his left and cuts it off

got him! Bowls four legspinners and brings this one back to bamboozle the big man. Superb bowling. Tosses it up outside off, Pollard wants to push this with the spin off the front foot, but the ball sneaks through between bat and pad
good length, spinning away from outside off, slashed to deep cover
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of  a length, comes in and goes under his attempted slog, just above the stumps
full outside off, wild heave at it, inside half of the bat, straight to deep midwicket
full at middle stump, tries to whip this into the leg side, inside edge onto pad and it lands in front of the bowler
full outside off, expansive drive, but it hits the bottom and bobbles harmlessly towards extra cover
back of a length outside off, goes for the big pull shot, gets it at the toe and and it flies towards Sohail Tanvir and lands in front of him
high full toss outside off, swings at it, misses...it's above the waist and we're going to have a free hit
length ball angled across the left hander, clears the front foot and slams it to mid-off's left

slower ball, back of a length outside off, goes for the pull, catches it on the hips and it rolls to the keeper. They've tried to sneak in a single, but the keeper gets a direct hit and there's no need for a review
clubbed! length ball on the pads, he hangs back and gets it right off the middle as he lifts it over deep square
yorker at middle, jams it out to long-on's right and the fielder has to scramble quickly to cut it off
yorker outside off, carved to covers who has a shy and misses by a mile, but there's no chance of a second
full on the pads, not the best of deliveries, but he's lift this with the angle and straight to deep square. He'll be thinking he could've put that away for runs.
Tanvir bowls another bad ball, and this time he's punished. Length ball at middle stump, lifted on the up easily over his head
thigh-high full toss, can only turn it to deep square leg. Wants a free-hit for this, but it wasn't high enough
in the blockhole outside off, Amir can't do anything at this and it's just a token swipe at it as he's beaten
another yorker outside off, clears the front leg, slices it between point and short third man
yorker outside off, jams it straight to cover
but it's all normalcy for us! Does what he's supposed to. Full, fast, straight. Timber. Goes under Sohail's slog and sounds sweet - depending on if you're a bowler or not - as it strikes the stumps
low full toss outside off, gets low and lifts it classily over the infield and it crosses the boundary on the bounce...and that's it. They fall short by seven runs. Great over by Irfan Jr.
